edu.umn.se.test.frame
Class TrapTestFramework

java.lang.Object
  edu.umn.se.test.frame.TrapTestFramework
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlcoholOnlyFundedByNonSponsoredGrantTest, AllUserFormsTests, ConferencePresentationInfoTest, CurrencyAbbreviationTest, DateValidatorTest, DoDForeignExpenseRestrictionTest, DoDMealRestrictionsTest, DomesticCarRentalTest, EmailAddressValidatorTest, FamilyMemberExpensesNotAllowedTest, ForeignGrantsNoDomesticTravelTest, FormDataConverterTest, FormTests, GrantApproverNameTest, GrantJustificationTest, GrantPercentSumTo100Test, IncidentalsPerDiemTest, InsufficientFundsTest, InternetOnlyUnderNonSponsoredGrant, LodgingPerDiemTest, MealPerDiemTest, NIHGrantRestrictionsTest, NoExportGrantsOnlyForUSCitizensTest, NoProcessingOnSaveTest, OneOrMoreGrantsAllValidTest, OnlyOneCheckedLuggageTest, OtherExpenseDateTest, OuputAvailableAfterProcessingTest, PerDayCarExpensesTest, PhoneNumberValidatorTest, RuleProcessingTest, SetUserTest, TestPartialExpenses, TransportationDatesTest, TransportationMileageExpensesTest, TransportationMilesIntegerTest, TravelTypeTest, UnknownKeyCheckerTest, USCarriersOnlyTest, UserFullNameTest, ValidUserOnFormTest, VisaStatusOutputTest
public class TrapTestFramework
extends java.lang.Object

This framework primarily acts as a driver to TRAP (TravelFormProcessor). It provides many methods for boilerplate functionality that most tests need such as setting a user, loading a form and saving it.

Author:
andrewh

Constructor Detail

TrapTestFramework

public TrapTestFramework()
Constructor for the test framework. It instantiates the TravelFormProcessor with our databases and initializes the TestDataGenerator class which loads the paths for known sample forms.

Method Detail

setup

public void setup(TestDataGenerator.SampleDataEnum formType)
           throws TRAPException
This is a convenience method to remove a lot of the boilerplate code that a lot of tests will need. Here is what it does:
- Loads the sample form of the given type (source)
- Sets the current user in TRAP to the user on the sample form
- Saves the form
- Returns the form data and the id of the saved form

Parameters:
formType - - The source for the sample form to load. This will correspond to a path defined in the TestDataGenerator.
Throws:
TRAPException - When there is an error saving the form

resaveTestForm

public void resaveTestForm()
                    throws TRAPException
Re-save the sample loaded form. The framework know the id of the form and has a reference to its data map and it will use this to make a driver call to TRAP to save over the existing form data.

Throws:
TRAPException - When there is an error saving the form

saveAndSubmitTestForm

public void saveAndSubmitTestForm()
                           throws TRAPException
Re-saves the sample loaded form and then submits it for processing.

Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error saving or during processing.

clearSavedForms

public void clearSavedForms()
                     throws TRAPException
A driver call to TRAP to clear all saved forms.

Throws:
TRAPException - When there is an error clearing the forms

getCompletedForm

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCompletedForm(java.lang.Integer id)
                                                                  throws TRAPException
A driver call to TRAP to get the data for the completed form with the given id.

Parameters:
id - - id of the completed form to fetch
Returns:
- The data for the completed form with formId = id
Throws:
TRAPException - - When the completed from cannot be retrieved.

                                                                  throws TRAPException
A driver call to TRAP to get the data for the saved form with the given id.

Parameters:
id - - id of the saved form to fetch
Returns:
- the data for the saved form with formId = id
Throws:
TRAPException - - When the saved from cannot be retrieved.

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,edu.umn.se.trap.TravelFormMetadata> getSavedForms()
                                                                                  throws TRAPException
A driver call to retrieve information on saved forms

Returns:
- A map of saved form ids to their metadata
Throws:
TRAPException - - When the saved form metadata cannot be retrieved.

getUser

public java.lang.String getUser()
A driver call to retrieve the current TRAP user

Returns:
- The current user in TRAP

saveFormData

public java.lang.Integer saveFormData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> formData,
                                      java.lang.String desc)
                               throws TRAPException
A driver call to save form data with a description which will result in a new id.

Parameters:
formData - - form data to save
desc - - The description to assign to the data
Returns:
- The id for the newly saved form
Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error saving the data

saveFormData

public java.lang.Integer saveFormData(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> formData,
                                      java.lang.Integer id)
                               throws TRAPException
A driver call to save form data over the existing form saved under the given form id.

Parameters:
formData - - the form data to save
id - - the id of the form to save this data over
Returns:
- The id of the newly saved form
Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error saving the data

setUser

public void setUser(java.lang.String user)
             throws TRAPException
Set the current user in TRAP.

Parameters:
user - - The user to set in TRAP.
Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error setting the user. Usually because the username is invalid/unknown.

submitFormData

public void submitFormData(java.lang.Integer id)
                    throws TRAPException
Submit the form saved under the provided id for processing.

Parameters:
id - - The id of the saved form to submit for processing.
Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error during processing.

basicTrapSetup

public Pair<java.lang.Integer,LoadedSampleForm> basicTrapSetup(TestDataGenerator.SampleDataEnum formType)
                                                        throws TRAPException
This method is used by the framework's #setup(SampleDataEnum) to do most of its work. Given a sample form type it loads it, saves it, sets the current user to the one in the sample form and returns the (formData, formId) for the newly saved form.

Parameters:
formType - - The source for the sample form to load. Look to TestDataGenerator for how this enum maps to files.
Returns:
- The form data and form id for the newly loaded/saved form.
Throws:
TRAPException - - when there is an error setting the user or saving the form.

getValidTestUser

public java.lang.String getValidTestUser(TestDataGenerator.SampleDataEnum whichForm)
Get the appropriate user for the given sample form. When submitting the form, the name on the form is checked against the current user in TRAP so it is necessary that this is set correctly.

Parameters:
whichForm - - The sample form type/source to get the username for.
Returns:
- The username for the given sample form.

setValidUser

public void setValidUser()
                  throws TRAPException
A boilerplate method for setting a valid user in the system. This method assumes you are using the domestic1 sample form.

Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error setting the user.

setValidUser

public void setValidUser(TestDataGenerator.SampleDataEnum formType)
                  throws TRAPException
Set the valid user in the system for the given sample form source.

Parameters:
formType - - The type of the sample form.
Throws:
TRAPException - - When there is an error setting the user in TRAP.

getLoadableForm

public LoadedSampleForm getLoadableForm(TestDataGenerator.SampleDataEnum source)
Load a sample form from the filesystem.

Parameters:
source - - The type/source for the sample form to load.
Returns:
- The LoadedSampleForm object which is a complete form that can be used within TRAP.

getExpectedOutput

public LoadedSampleForm getExpectedOutput(TestDataGenerator.SampleDataEnum source)
Get the expected output for a given sample form. On the filesystem these are the same filename but with a .output appendix.

Parameters:
source - - The source for the file whose expected output to load
Returns:
- A LoadedSampleForm (ie map of strings) representing the expected output of the source sample form.

getExpectedOutput

public LoadedSampleForm getExpectedOutput(LoadedSampleForm form)
Get the expected output of the given LoadedSampleForm. The filename for the sample form is stored in this object so the output can be retrieved assuming it follows the standard .output naming convention.

Parameters:
form - - The input sample form whose expected output is needed.
Returns:
- The expected output corresponding to the given form.

doOutputsMatch

public boolean doOutputsMatch(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> output,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> expected)
                       throws InputValidationException
Check if the output of two maps are the same. This is explicitly checking maps that are the result of TRAP processing.

Parameters:
output - - The actual output of processing a form
expected - - The expected output of the form processing
Returns:
- True if they both match using the semantics of TRAP output or false if they don't
Throws:
InputValidationException - -

mapDifference

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> mapDifference(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> m1,
                                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> m2)
Find the differences in the two maps.

Parameters:
m1 - - Map1 to check
m2 - - Map2 to check
Returns:
- A list of strings is returned containing field names. Field names are prepended with <missing> if they are in m1 but not m2. Field names are prepended with <diff> if their value is different in m1 and m2.
